alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; Orange County Inland; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 7:54PM PST until January 09 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...All of Orange County, The Riverside and San Bernardino County Mountains, The Inland Empire, and the San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding in and near burn scars, creeks, normally dry stream beds, and poorly drained intersections and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong Pacific storm will bring an extended period of moderate to heavy rainfall. Excessive rain rates are likely over the San Bernardino Mountains where flooding are debris flows are most likely late Monday night through Tuesday. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
